data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, which provides sentiment scores (neutral, positive, negative) to individual word meanings (synsets).

It includes approximately 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies trading on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, which helps to better identify, interpret, and process concepts in this context by combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies.

This incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines with multiple entities potentially having conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset of over 10,700 news headlines provides information on sentiment variations based on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. The objective of this resource is to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships within financial documents, including approximately 29,000 examples and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, it allows researchers to determine how news headlines influence price fluctuations, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) within the financial landscape, which assists in identifying and classifying financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real-world financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, it simplifies multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
